framebuffer::​FB

FB is the main framebuffer that implements I/O primitives for the framebuffer. There are several subclasses of FB: VirtualFB, FileFB and HardwareFB.

  • The VirtualFB uses memory as the framebuffer

  • The FileFB is an mmap backed file, which can be used for debugging or emulating the app. It saves the current framebuffer to fb.png every time the screen is refreshed

  • The HardwareFB interfaces with /dev/fb0, which is the linux framebuffer device. In addition to mmaping /dev/fb0, HardwareFB also sends ioctl to the FB

Functions
clear_screen
void clear_screen():

blanks the framebuffer with WHITE pixels

redraw_screen
int redraw_screen(
bool full_screen= false
):

if the framebuffer is dirty, redraws the dirty area of the framebuffer.

get_display_size
virtual tuple<int, int> get_display_size():

get the size of the framebuffer's display

draw_pixel
inline void draw_pixel(
int x,
y,
color
):

draw a pixel at the x,y position of color COLOR.

color must be one of BLACK or WHITE

draw_rect
inline void draw_rect(
int o_x,
o_y,
w,
h,
color,
fill= true,
float dither= 1.0
):

draws a rect on screen.

Params
o_x
int

the x offset to draw the rectangle at

o_y
int

the y offset to draw the rectangle at

w
int

the width of the rectangle

h
int

the height of the rectangle

color
int

the color of the rect, can be WHITE, BLACK, GRAY, RUBBER or ERASER

dither
float

how much dithering to apply to the pixels

draw_bitmap
def draw_bitmap(
image_data &image,
int o_x,
int o_y
):

this function draws the content of image into the framebuffer

parameters:

image

the image to write to the framebuffer. an image consists of a buffer and a width and height

o_x

the x offset

o_y

the y offset

draw_text
void draw_text(
int x,
y,
string text,
int fs= 24
):

a conveniece function for drawing text to the framebuffer

parameters: x - the x offset y - the y offset text - the text to draw fs - the font size to draw at

framebuffer::​get

this function returns the app's framebuffer

NOTE: the framebuffer is a singleton
